body: LGTM

I've been browsing around the site and it looks awesome. Super polished and full of useful information/links. The biweekly hangout minutes is the only piece I found missing. Let's work with @kensipe to get this committed to the subversion repo and published.

@klucar Can you please add a ["Disclaimer"](http://incubator.apache.org/guides/branding.html#disclaimers)  as mandated by Apache for incubator projects? 

I browsed around the websites of some incubator projects and I liked how [Kylin](http://kylin.incubator.apache.org/development/) did it - they have the disclaimer in the footer for all the pages.

Site updated. I just took the text from the Kylin project and changed Kylin
to Myriad. I'm now ready for law school.

Preview here:
http://klucar.github.io/myriad-site/

wrote:

> mandated by Apache for incubator projects?
>

> Kylin http://kylin.incubator.apache.org/development/ did it - they have
> the disclaimer in the footer for all the pages.
> 
> â€”
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/apache/incubator-myriad/pull/4#issuecomment-147468674
> .

This is now in the footer of each page.

Disclaimer:Apache Mesos is an effort undergoing incubation at The Apache Software Foundation (ASF), sponsored by the Apache Incubator. Incubation is required of all newly accepted projects until a further review indicates that the infrastructure, communications, and decision making process have stabilized in a manner consistent with other successful ASF projects. While incubation status is not necessarily a reflection of the completeness or stability of the code, it does indicate that the project has yet to be fully endorsed by the ASF.

Preview here

http://klucar.github.io/myriad-site/

Apache Mesos -> Apache Myriad

---

Sent from mobile

Please explain why this PR was closed. Because this was merged already, or because we'll just apply the site to the svn repo?
Maybe we should host the website source in git as well, so we can more easily make PRs, and then we'll just periodically update svn from the latest git site. We just have to be clear that all changes are made in git, and mirrored to svn, so manual changes to svn don't get overwritten.

It was my understanding from the last telecon that I would close this PR
because it was going to live in SVN. I'm for whatever is easiest. Ken and I
have been trying to hook up today to figure this out. Maybe let us play
with the SVN setup and we'll know which way will work better?

> â€”

> .

I feel it'll be easier to do PRs if the website source is in git (in
addition to being in SVN).

Santosh

Sounds good, and it's what I thought. I just want to get the reason/discussion down in a comment here so anybody else passing by knows why.
Old Apache motto: "If it didn't happen on a mailing list, it didn't happen."
Ship it
Ship It!

Thanks so much for doing this, Jim. I made a quick pass, but it was difficult to judge exactly what changed in the renamed files.
- Could you possibly separate this patch so that the file rename is a separate commit? This'll make it much easier to review.
- Changing from `com.ebay` to `org.apache` affects the alpha-order of the imports. Could you please fix the order too (in a separate commit/PR, if you like)?
- Can you also add the LICENSE/NOTICE files, as per https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/MYRIAD-41?

I was thinking about this for a while and perhaps it's better to share with you folks. When we merge all the outstanding PRs into apache's git repo, should we do this last? The reason I'm thinking about is, since we changed the package namespace, a lot of files have moved around. If we merge this one first and then followed by a bunch of PRs that has com.ebay namespace, all of them would have to rebase. Instead, if we merge this last, we could just rebase this one. Thoughts?
LGTM. How about the LICENSE and NOTICE files?

Even if we decide to defer the namespace changes, we can still fix the license/headers now.

If you don't want the 7 other PRs to have to rebase, maybe we should set a deadline, e.g. next Monday morning, Jim will run his vim magic on the latest master and we will merge this in. Any remaining outstanding PRs will have to rebase against the new namespace. That gives us a grace period for PRs that are almost shippable, and Jim won't have to keep rebasing every time something gets merged in.
We have LICENSE and NOTICE files already in the project.
Right on. Ship it! :rocket:
Great. Sounds good!
Great! Sounds good.

I'm not for putting this off any longer. Git tracks the namespace and file moves, so people will just have to merge on their own if a PR isn't in. I'll make the rest of the suggested changes in individual commits.

I broke this up into separate commits and held off with the namespace change for now. Deadline of Monday sometime sounds good to me. I submitted a new PR because updating this PR would require a force push, i.e. bad git foo.

one was out of date.

everything in public is auto-generated.

@klucar: This patch is not applying cleanly anymore as I merged a couple of other PRs into the master branch. Can you please rebase?

Also, the cause for the failure wasn't apparent when I tried it last week. I'll try it out again today.

Santosh,

I'll do it one more time, but no matter what its going to be painful unless
you merge nothing else before it. Anything after will have to be
refactored. If there's some outstanding pulls you want first I'll wait.
Just let me know when.

Also, with the namespace change and indentation correction, I observed that some of the multi-line statements were collapsed to a single long line. Was that intentional? For e.g.: https://github.com/apache/incubator-myriad/blob/master/myriad-scheduler/src/main/java/org/apache/myriad/scheduler/fgs/YarnNodeCapacityManager.java#L215

While you are at it, could you also please take care of adding explicit imports for statements like this: https://github.com/apache/incubator-myriad/blob/master/myriad-scheduler/src/main/java/org/apache/myriad/scheduler/fgs/YarnNodeCapacityManager.java#L70
Ship It! :rocket:

We really need to come up with a formatter for IDEA and Eclipse. I've been
tweaking mine so that I can just reformat files and everything is good.
There are still some quirks. The checkstyles is set to 250 columns, so I
complied with that and it looks like it unwrapped things.

Thanks @klucar . Regarding the line wrapping, I guess we need to agree on a reasonable line length. How about 120?

Well 80 is the old punch card standard, and 132 is the "widescreen"
terminal standard. So I'd say 132 to keep up with outdated requirements.

Tested it on my dev setup, but the RM can't come up. It throws me the following null pointer:

```
Caused by: java.lang.NullPointerException
        at org.apache.myriad.webapp.MyriadWebServer.start(MyriadWebServer.java:64)
        at org.apache.myriad.Main.initWebApp(Main.java:119)
        at org.apache.myriad.Main.run(Main.java:91)
        at org.apache.myriad.Main.initialize(Main.java:76)
        at org.apache.myriad.scheduler.yarn.interceptor.MyriadInitializationInterceptor.init(MyriadInitializationInterceptor.java:51)
        ... 16 more
```

The corresponding code in the webserver is:

``` java
    String staticDir = this.getClass().getClassLoader().getResource("webapp/public").toExternalForm();
```

The myriad-scheduler-0.1.jar doesn't have "webapp/public". The build doesn't seem to copy "webapp/public" under the build directory.

I saw that once but couldn't reproduce it. I figured it was just from me
trying to get everything working. A few questions: did you gradle or
gradlew? Were the files generated in src/main/resources/webapp/public and
just didn't make it into the jar? I'll try to reproduce again this morning.

Thannks @bgulla . The changes look good to me.

I applied your change locally and grep'ed through for occurrences of "2.7.1" hadoop version. Looks like some .md files needs to be changed.  While you are at this, can you also please change those files?

```
./docs/myriad-remote-distribution-configuration.md:* You are using hadoop-2.7.1 downloaded from [hadoop.apache.org](http://hadoop.apache.org).  Specific vendor versions should work but may require additional steps. 
./docs/myriad-remote-distribution-configuration.md:**NOTE:** The default location for $YARN_HOME is **/opt/hadoop-2.7.1**.
./docs/myriad-remote-distribution-configuration.md:cp myriad-scheduler/build/libs/*.jar /opt/hadoop-2.7.1/share/hadoop/yarn/lib/
./docs/myriad-remote-distribution-configuration.md:cp myriad-executor/build/libs/myriad-executor-0.0.1.jar /opt/hadoop-2.7.1/share/hadoop/yarn/lib/
./docs/myriad-remote-distribution-configuration.md:cp myriad-scheduler/build/resources/main/myriad-config-default.yml /opt/hadoop-2.7.1/etc/hadoop/
./docs/myriad-remote-distribution-configuration.md:  nodeManagerUri: hdfs://namenode:port/dist/hadoop-2.7.1.tar.gz
./docs/myriad-remote-distribution-configuration.md:YARN_HOME: hadoop-2.7.1                # This should be relative if nodeManagerUri is set  
./docs/myriad-remote-distribution-configuration.md:sudo cp -rp /opt/hadoop-2.7.1 .
./docs/myriad-remote-distribution-configuration.md:sudo rm ~/hadoop-2.7.1/etc/hadoop/yarn-site.xml
./docs/myriad-remote-distribution-configuration.md:sudo tar -zcpf ~/hadoop-2.7.1.tar.gz hadoop-2.7.1
./docs/myriad-remote-distribution-configuration.md:hadoop fs -put ~/hadoop-2.7.1.tar.gz /dist
./docs/myriad-dev.md:cp myriad-scheduler/build/libs/*.jar /opt/hadoop-2.7.1/share/hadoop/yarn/lib/
./docs/myriad-dev.md:cp myriad-executor/build/libs/myriad-executor-0.0.1.jar /opt/hadoop-2.7.1/share/hadoop/yarn/lib/
./docs/myriad-dev.md:cp myriad-scheduler/build/resources/main/myriad-config-default.yml /opt/hadoop-2.7.1/etc/hadoop/
./docs/API.md:        "YARN_HOME": "/root/hadoop-2.7.1"
./docs/install-overview.md:* Hadoop 2.7.1
./docs/getting-started.md:cd hadoop-2.7.1/sbin && yarn-daemon.sh start resourcemanager
./docs/myriad-configuration.md:  YARN_HOME: /usr/local/hadoop # Or /opt/mapr/hadoop/hadoop-2.7.1/ if using MapR's Hadoop

```
